body_html: MPI is the way to go for RDMA support on compute clusters - this is the most common setup. There is also RDMA versions of Hadoop/Spark/Hbase. So the data side is distributed. As for the distributed learning, TF is behind CNTK - which runs on MPI and thus has RDMA for free. gRPC is dead end, particularly given GPUDirect RDMA.
